title: Yahoo Lifestyle
text: Johnny: One of the ideas behind the American form of government was that NO ONE PERSON should ever have the power or ability to unilaterally define the nation's course and actions. So the power of governance was divided into three branches: A branch overseen by the President to execute and administer the laws of the country; a branch to create/legislate those laws and oversee the activities of the 'executive' branch; and a judicial branch to serve as arbiter in determining if the activities of the other two branches were in accordance with the provisions of the nation's Constitution. It was believed that with these 'tools' the citizen's of the nation would be able to forestall any President from ever achieving the power of a dictator. But now we have a senate who has abdicated its constitutional duties and responsibilities and given the President 'Carte blanche' authority to do however as he chooses. ...And a President who selects members of the judiciary, not for their wisdom and allegiance to the Constitution, but for their fealty to him and the policies of his political party. The Founding Fathers placed their trust in the vigilance of the people, and a belief that they would zealously protect the nation from ever allowing the rise of the type of tyrannical one-man-rule the nation had just freed itself from under King George III. We all make mistakes...
